summaryText: Wow, what an incredible message about personal transformation from Pastor Travis Hearn! In this powerful sermon, PT dives deep into the profound truth that when we encounter Jesus, we are completely made new. He walks us through what it truly means to say 'I'm not who I used to be' by exploring four incredible ways God transforms us: giving us a new creation, a new heart, a new mind, and new eyes. Pastor Travis shares from personal experience how God can radically change a person's entire trajectory, using the apostle Paul's dramatic conversion as a powerful example. He challenges us to embrace that transformation is a process - we won't be perfect overnight, but God is faithfully working in us, removing our hard, deceived, and broken hearts, and replacing them with hearts of flesh that can truly see and understand His love. The sermon is a beautiful reminder that no matter our past, God's grace is bigger, His love is deeper, and His power to transform is absolutely unmatched. Can you imagine a God so powerful that He can take a persecutor of Christians and turn him into one of the greatest church planters in history? That's the same God working in us today!
mainPoints: When you encounter Jesus, you become a new creation
God gives us a new heart that can feel, heal, and love
Transformation is a process, not an instant event

versesMentioned.text: Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, the new creation has come: The old has gone, the new is here!
As far as the east is from the west, so far has he removed our transgressions from us.
I will give you a new heart and put a new spirit in you; I will remove from you your heart of stone and give you a heart of flesh.
Do not conform to the pattern of this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind. Then you will be able to test and approve what God's will is—his good, pleasing and perfect will.
Being confident of this, that he who began a good work in you will carry it on to completion until the day of Christ Jesus.
Forget the former things; do not dwell on the past. See, I am doing a new thing! Now it springs up; do you not perceive it?
The heart is deceitful above all things and beyond cure. Who can understand it?

Monday.scripture: 2 Corinthians 5:17: 'Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, the new creation has come: The old has gone, the new is here!'
Monday.focus: Embracing your new identity in Christ
Monday.action: Write down three ways your old self used to think or act, and three ways you want your new self in Christ to think and act. Reflect on the transformative power of God in your life.
Monday.prayer: Lord, thank You for making me new. Help me fully embrace my identity in Christ and let go of who I used to be. Guide me to live as the new creation You've designed me to be. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Ezekiel 36:26: 'I will give you a new heart and put a new spirit in you; I will remove from you your heart of stone and give you a heart of flesh.'
Tuesday.focus: Allowing God to soften your heart
Tuesday.action: Identify an area where your heart has become hardened - perhaps toward a person, situation, or even yourself. Spend time in prayer asking God to give you a heart of flesh that can feel, heal, and love.
Tuesday.prayer: Father, soften the areas of my heart that have become hardened. Remove my heart of stone and replace it with a heart that is tender, compassionate, and responsive to Your leading. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Romans 12:2: 'Do not conform to the pattern of this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind.'
Wednesday.focus: Renewing your mind through God's word
Wednesday.action: Spend extra time in scripture today. Choose a passage and read it slowly, asking God to renew your thinking and help you see things from His perspective.
Wednesday.prayer: God, transform my mind today. Help me see beyond worldly perspectives and align my thoughts with Your truth. Renew my mind and help me think like You think. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Philippians 1:6: 'Being confident of this, that he who began a good work in you will carry it on to completion until the day of Christ Jesus.'
Thursday.action: Journal about a area of personal growth where you've seen God working. Acknowledge that transformation takes time and be patient with yourself.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, thank You that You are faithful to complete the work You've started in me. Help me be patient with myself and trust Your timing in my transformation. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Isaiah 43:19: 'See, I am doing a new thing! Now it springs up; do you not perceive it?'
Friday.focus: Being open to God's new things
Friday.action: Ask God to show you something new He is doing in your life. Be intentional about being aware and receptive to His work.
Friday.prayer: Father, open my spiritual eyes to see the new things You are doing. Help me not be stuck in old patterns but be ready and excited for Your fresh work in my life. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Jeremiah 29:11: 'For I know the plans I have for you,' declares the Lord, 'plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.'
Saturday.action: Spend time in prayer mapping out your hopes and dreams, surrendering them to God and asking Him to align your heart with His purpose.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, I surrender my plans to You. Transform my desires to match Your perfect plan. Help me trust that Your way is always better than my own. Amen.
